H0.text: Micronutrients are the term used to describe the minerals and vitamins that are not needed for providing the body with energy but are still essential for good health.

H1.text: Salts are the minerals and vitamins that are not needed for providing the body with energy but are still essential for good health.

H2.text: Pigments are the minerals and vitamins that are not needed for providing the body with energy but are still essential for good health.

H3.text: Non-energetic nutrients are the minerals and vitamins that are not needed for providing the body with energy but are still essential for good health.

A4.text: Micronutrients are essential chemicals required by organisms in small quantities to perform various biogeochemical processes and regulate physiological functions of cells and organs.

A5.text: Human micronutrient requirements are in amounts generally less than 100 milligrams per day, whereas macronutrients are required in gram quantities daily.
